src package¶

Submodules¶

src.arguments module¶

Handle arguments from command line

src.arguments.get_list_of_uuids()¶

With the argument “–list” the path to a file with a list of uuids is given. Here the file is opened and all uuids are returned in a list.

Returns:

List of UUIDs

src.arguments.get_uuid()¶

Returns UUID from argument list

Returns:

UUID

src.arguments.raed_arguments()¶

Used Argument parser. Detailed overview with -h.

Returns:

parsed arguments

src.main module¶

Main Class: Start program

src.uuid_custom module¶

Handle UUIDs.

src.uuid_custom.check_single_uuid(uuid_value)¶

This method checks if the given uuid_value is valid. In addition, information is extracted from the UUID for valid values and the reason is identified for invalid values.

Parameters:

uuid_value – UUID

Returns:

Results are printed in the Command Line.

src.uuid_custom.check_why_uuid_is_not_valid(uuid_value)¶

Checks, why UUID is not valid. - Check if UUID is valid - Check if only hexadecimal numbers are used - Check pattern 8-4-4-12 - Check Version (1-5) - Check Variant -> Reason not found

Parameters:

uuid_value – UUID

Returns:

String as Reason

src.uuid_custom.get_uuid_variant(uuid_value)¶

Returns UUID Variant.

Parameters:

uuid_value – UUID

Returns:

Variant as String

src.uuid_custom.get_uuid_version(uuid_value)¶

Returns UUID Version

Parameters:

uuid_value – UUID

Returns:

Version or reason when version is invalid

src.uuid_custom.is_uuid_valid(uuid_value)¶

Checks, if UUID is valid.

Format: 8-4-4-4-12 (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-Mxxx-Nxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx), not case-sensitive M: version, only 1-5 available N: variant, only 0-9a-d available

Returns:

Boolean Value

Module contents¶

Verify uuid
